question: I am currently pregnant with my second child.  I had a terrible experience with my first.  I ended up having to have an emergency c section due to a prolapsed cord....it took 11 minutes to get my son breathing.  Afterwards, I was sent to X-Ray to have an instrument count b/c they didn't do one... luckily, nothing was in there.  I ended up with a terrible infection and my incision tore back open a couple of weeks later.  I could go on and on but I won't..just trying to paint a picture of how scared I am to go in for another c section.  I have (obviously) switched to a different doctor now but I'm still scared to death!  Has anyone had a tramatic experience with an emergency c section followed by a good experience with a scheduled one that could help make me feel better?!
title: Planned C Section vs. Emergency C Section
